00024 #include <amber_traj.hpp>
00025 #include <AtomicGroup.hpp>
00026 #include <iomanip>
00027 #include <sstream>
00028 
00029 namespace loos {
00030 
00031   // Scan the trajectory file to determine frame sizes and box
00032   void AmberTraj::init(void) {
00033     char buf[1024];
00034 
00035     ifs()->getline(buf, 1024);
00036     frame_offset = ifs()->tellg();
00037     greal x, y, z;
00038 
00039     for (uint i=0; i<_natoms; i++) {
00040       *(ifs()) >> std::setw(8) >> x >> std::setw(8) >> y >> std::setw(8) >> z;
00041       frame.push_back(GCoord(x,y,z));
00042     }
00043 
00044 
00045     // This is probably not a good way of doing this???
00046     ifs()->getline(buf, 1024);
00047     unsigned long fpos = ifs()->tellg();
00048 
00049     ifs()->getline(buf, 1024);
00050     if (ifs()->fail())
00051       throw(std::runtime_error("Error- cannot scan the amber trajectory"));
00052 
00053     std::stringstream ss(buf);
00054     double a= -1, b= -1, c= -1;
00055     ss >> std::setw(8) >> a >> std::setw(8) >> b >> std::setw(8) >> c;
00056     if (ss.eof()) {
00057       fpos = ifs()->tellg();
00058       periodic = true;
00059       box = GCoord(a, b, c);
00060     }
00061 
00062     frame_size = fpos - frame_offset;
00063 
00064     // Now try to count the number of frames...
00065     _nframes = 1;
00066     double dummy;
00067     while (!ifs()->fail()) {
00068       ++_nframes;
00069       fpos = _nframes * frame_size + frame_offset;
00070       ifs()->seekg(fpos);
00071       *(ifs()) >> dummy;
00072     }
00073 
00074 
00075     ifs()->clear();
00076     ifs()->seekg(frame_offset + frame_size);
00077 
00078     // Punt our failure check to the end...for now...
00079     if (ifs()->fail())
00080       throw(std::runtime_error("Unable to divine frame information from amber trajectory"));
00081 
00082     cached_first = true;
00083   }
00084 
00085 
00086   bool AmberTraj::parseFrame(void) {
00087     greal x, y, z;
00088 
00089     if (ifs()->eof())
00090       return(false);
00091 
00092     // It seems that it's possible that, at the end of the trajectory,
00093     // we may have read the last datum from the last frame but will not
00094     // be physically at the EOF.  So, we also check inside the coord
00095     // read loop to see if there is an EOF.  Rather than flag this as an
00096     // error condition, just return a false indicating we've read past
00097     // the end...
00098 
00099     for (uint i=0; i<_natoms && !(ifs()->eof()); i++) {
00100       *(ifs()) >> std::setw(8) >> x >> std::setw(8) >> y >> std::setw(8) >> z;
00101       frame[i] = GCoord(x, y, z);
00102     }
00103 
00104     if (ifs()->eof())
00105       return(false);
00106 
00107     if (periodic) {
00108       greal a, b, c;
00109       *(ifs()) >> std::setw(8) >> a >> std::setw(8) >> b >> std::setw(8) >> c;
00110       box = GCoord(a, b, c);
00111     }
00112 
00113     if (ifs()->fail())
00114       throw(std::runtime_error("Error- IO error while reading Amber trajectory frame"));
00115 
00116     return(true);
00117   }
00118 
00119 
00120   void AmberTraj::seekFrameImpl(const uint i) {
00121 
00122     cached_first = false;
00123     unsigned long fpos = i * frame_size + frame_offset;
00124     if (i >= _nframes)
00125       throw(std::runtime_error("Error- attempting to read an invalid frame from an Amber trajectory"));
00126 
00127 
00128     ifs()->seekg(fpos);
00129     if (ifs()->fail())
00130       throw(std::runtime_error("Error- cannot seek to the requested frame in an Amber trajectory"));
00131   }
00132 
00133 
00134   void AmberTraj::updateGroupCoords(AtomicGroup& g) {
00135     AtomicGroup::Iterator iter(g);
00136     pAtom pa;
00137 
00138     while (pa = iter()) {
00139       uint i = pa->id() - 1;
00140       if (i >= _natoms)
00141         throw(std::runtime_error("Attempting to index a nonexistent atom in AmberTraj::updateGroupCoords()"));
00142       pa->coords(frame[i]);
00143     }
00144 
00145     if (periodic)
00146       g.periodicBox(box);
00147   }

00150 }
